section.para: The ngx_http_gzip_module module is a filter that compresses responses using the “gzip” method. This often allows to reduce the size of transmitted data by half or even more.

section.name: Example Configuration
section.para: The $gzip_ratio variable can be used to log the achieved compression ratio.

directive.name: gzip
directive.para: Enables or disables gzipping of responses.

directive.name: gzip_buffers
directive.para:
Sets the number and size of buffers used to compress a response. By default, the buffer size is equal to one memory page. This is either 4K or 8K, depending on a platform.
Until version 0.7.28, four 4K or 8K buffers were used by default.

directive.name: gzip_comp_level
directive.para: Sets a gzip compression level of a response. Acceptable values are in the 1..9 range.

directive.name: gzip_disable
directive.para: Disables gzipping of responses for requests with User-Agent header fields matching any of the specified regular expressions.
The special mask “msie6” (0.7.12) corresponds to the regular expression “MSIE [4-6]\.” but works faster. Starting from version 0.8.11, “MSIE 6.0; ... SV1” is excluded from this mask.

directive.name: gzip_min_length
directive.para: Sets the minimum length of a response that will be gzipped. The length is determined only from the Content-Length response header field.

directive.name: gzip_http_version
directive.para: Sets the minimum HTTP version of a request required to compress a response.

directive.name: gzip_proxied
directive.syntax: off | expired | no-cache | no-store | private | no_last_modified | no_etag | auth | any ...

directive.name: gzip_types
directive.para: Enables gzipping of responses for the specified MIME types in addition to “text/html”. The special value “*” matches any MIME type (0.8.29). Responses with the type “text/html” are always compressed.

directive.name: gzip_vary
directive.para:
Enables or disables emitting the Vary: Accept-Encoding response header field if the directives , , or
are active.
